name: Balti Chicken
history: Balti Chicken is believed to have originated from the northern region of Pakistan and gained popularity in the United Kingdom. It's named after the steel or iron pot in which it is cooked, known as a 'Balti'.
description: Balti Chicken is a type of curry that is cooked and often served in a round-bottomed wok-like vessel known as a 'Balti'. It typically features stir-fried chicken in a rich and aromatic sauce, made with a blend of spices, tomatoes, and bell peppers.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a balti pan or wok. Add onions and ginger-garlic paste, cooking until onions are soft. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, and garam masala.

instructions.title: Cook the Chicken
instructions.description: Add chicken pieces to the pan. Cook until the chicken is browned on all sides.

instructions.title: Add Vegetables
instructions.description: Add chopped bell peppers and tomatoes to the pan. Cook until the vegetables are tender.

instructions.title: Simmer the Curry
instructions.description: Add water to achieve the desired consistency. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the chicken is fully cooked.

instructions.title: Finish with Lemon Juice
instructions.description: Stir in lemon juice. Cook for a few more minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.

tips: Ensure that the chicken is well-seared to lock in flavors.
Adjust the amount of chili powder according to your spice preference.
variations: Add a splash of cream for a richer gravy.
Include other vegetables like carrots or peas for added nutrition.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional balti dish for authenticity.
Pair with a side of raita or a fresh salad.
